results.title: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.
results.title_for_label: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
results.description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.

results.title: Round the twist: Santa Claws
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Mark Lewis, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Pete’s dream comes true when he meets Santa Claws Number 115,302 who grants each member of the Twist family two wishes, something they all end up wishing had never happened.

results.title: Round the twist: birdsdo
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Nell is committed to hospital for believing in dragons; so Linda, Pete and Bronson set off to prove her sanity. While rogue seagulls imprison Linda and Pete in a shack buried in bird droppings, Bronson finds the dragon’s egg and Nell is released.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
results.description: Nell is committed to hospital for believing in dragons; so Linda, Pete and Bronson set off to prove her sanity. While rogue seagulls imprison Linda and Pete in a shack buried in bird droppings, Bronson finds the dragon’s egg and Nell is released.

results.title: Round the twist: a good tip for ghosts
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: To pass a nerve test, Pete has to collect a rotting skull from the pond at the tip in the middle of the night. But he encounters the resident ghost who wants something from him.
results.title_for_label: Round the twist: a good tip for ghosts
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: The Sound of a Meringue Being Tortured
results.creator_credit: Antony Riddell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. A stop-motion animated short film where the characters repeatedly ask ‘Are you alright, mate?’.

results.title: Hopes and Dreams
results.creator_credit: Alex Litsoudis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Alex tells of a horrifying abuse he suffered in his childhood that resulted in permanent effects on his life. Following his passion for drama, Alex co-founded the ‘Ability Bunch’.

results.title: Going to my mum's house
results.creator_credit: Debbie Lissek and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Debbie lives in a hostel, but spends weekends at her mum’s house. In this story, Debbie gives an outline of the activities she and her mum routinely enjoy on the weekends.
results.description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. results.title: Going to Nan & Pop's Farm
results.creator_credit: Candice Jones and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Candice recounts the fond memories of visiting her grandparents’ flower farm. This story is told with animated illustrations, photographs and video footage.
results.description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Candice recounts the fond memories of visiting her grandparents’ flower farm. This story is told with animated illustrations, photographs and video footage.
